titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Records of the Reiss Center on Law and Security RG.22.15
titlestmt.author: Rachel Searcy

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-21 14:38:36 -0500.

did.unittitle: Records of the Reiss Center on Law and Security

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: New York University. Center on Law and Security

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: New York University. Center on Law and Security

did.abstract: The Reiss Center on Law and Security is a non-partison multidisciplinary research institute at NYU School of Law. Founded in 2003 as the Center on Law and Security and renamed in 2018, the center facilitates dialogue and produces research on legal, policy, and strategic issues in the field of national security. The Reiss Center holds public events, conferences, and workshops; hosts policy groups; produces research and writing in both academic and popular media; sponsors fellowships from leading experts in the field; and offers academic programs for students at NYU School of Law. This collection consists of publications issued by the Reiss Center for Law and Security, and includes reports and issue briefs concerning security law, foreign policy, military affairs, and national security strategy.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of publications issued by the Reiss Center for Law and Security at the NYU School of Law. Materials include reports and issue briefs concerning security law, foreign policy, military affairs, and national security strategy.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by New York University are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact university-archives@nyu.edu.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the Reiss Center for Law and Security in March 2019; the accession number associated with this transfer is 2019.038.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Reiss Center for Law and Security Publications; RG 22.15; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused in archival boxes and folders, and described on the collection-level with a box inventory.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Reiss Center on Law and Security is a non-partison multidisciplinary research institute at NYU School of Law. Founded in 2003 as the Center on Law and Security and renamed in 2018, the center facilitates dialogue and produces research on legal, policy, and strategic issues in the field of national security. The Reiss Center holds public events, conferences, and workshops; hosts policy groups; produces research and writing in both academic and popular media; sponsors fellowships from leading experts in the field; and offers academic programs for students at NYU School of Law.
